title: Enabling `cfg(no_global_oom_handling)` via `-Zbuild-std` causes build failure in `core`
body: I am currently trying to enable `cfg(no_global_oom_handling)` and the build of `core` fails. (My attempt was based on [this StackOverflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/74722089/rust-how-do-i-actually-enable-cfgno-global-oom-handling).) Here are the commands to reproduce: ``` $ cargo new proj Created binary (application) `proj` package $ cd proj $ rustup override set nightly $ RUSTFLAGS="--cfg no_global_oom_handling" cargo +nightly build -Z build-std --target x86_64-apple-darwin # or other target for the current machine Compiling compiler_builtins v0.1.87 Compiling core v0.0.0 (/Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core) Compiling libc v0.2.139 Compiling cc v1.0.77 Compiling memchr v2.5.0 Compiling std v0.0.0 (/Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std) Compiling unwind v0.0.0 (/Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/unwind) error[E0773]: attempted to define built-in macro more than once --> /Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/macros/mod.rs:1310:5 | 1310 | macro_rules! cfg { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | note: previously defined here --> /Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/macros/mod.rs:1310:5 | 1310 | / macro_rules! cfg { 1311 | | ($($cfg:tt)*) => { 1312 | | /* compiler built-in */ 1313 | | }; 1314 | | } | |_____^ error[E0152]: found duplicate lang item `manually_drop` --> /Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/mem/manually_drop.rs:50:1 | 50 | pub struct ManuallyDrop { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: the lang item is first defined in crate `core`. = note: first definition in `core` loaded from /Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/libcore-d0a8c087921eb265.rlib = note: second definition in the local crate (`core`) error[E0152]: found duplicate lang item `maybe_uninit` --> /Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/mem/maybe_uninit.rs:249:1 | 249 | pub union MaybeUninit { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: the lang item is first defined in crate `core`. = note: first definition in `core` loaded from /Users/shzhang/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/libcore-d0a8c087921eb265.rlib = note: second definition in the local crate (`core`) [many additional "duplicate lang item" and other errors] error: could not compile `core` (lib) due to 3534 previous errors ``` The issue requires `no_global_oom_handling`; if I change it to some random string, the error does not occur. For reference, I have attached the full stderr output, with `cargo build [...] --verbose`. [output.txt](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/11107783/output.txt) Is this a real bug or am I just doing something stupid here? ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (2036fdd24 2023-03-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2036fdd24f77d607dcfaa24c48fbe85d3f785823 commit-date: 2023-03-27 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.0 ```
